headline.main: SPY DATA SOUGHT OF CAA OFFICIAL; German-Born U.S. Citizen Testifies That Eilers Asked for War Plane Figures SENT BY 'AN OLD FRIEND' Prosecution Closes Its Case Against Heine -- He Admits Sending Reports to Reich

lead_paragraph: A high official of the Civil Aeronautics Administration testified yesterday at the Brooklyn espionage trial that he had been approached in the Spring of 1940 with a request to furnish information on United States airplane shipments to the Allies to members of an alleged German spy ring.
abstract: A Vollmecke, CAA official, testifies that Eilers sought plane data; Heine admits compiling rept for transmission to Germany; Pagel and Schlosser change pleas to not guilty of aiding Ludwig
